subsc: Banking,Payments, settlements, and remittance systems,Law and justice,Central government administration

abstracts.cdata!:
Overall, the project outcome is
            satisfactory, sustainability likely, and the institutional
            development impact substantial. Experience from the project
            convey the following lessons. In a post conflict
            environment, a clear strategic framework, and rapid
            restoration of security provides a solid foundation for
            project development. The broad nature of the project
            objectives - implement major structural reforms, both in the
            financial sector and public administration - was important,
            as it allowed the project to respond to evolving government
            needs, and in addition, the project's advisory services
            provided an anchor of stability, and continuity during
            successive governments. The strong Government commitment to
            reform resulted in major sectoral changes in a relatively
            short period of time, that is within about two years, the
            Government, with Bank assistance, was able to achieve a
            major transformation of all three state-owned banks, and
            establish the foundation for a sound, commercially-based
            banking system. The strong Government commitment to reform,
            and ownership of the project, despite several changes in
            government, were critical elements in the project's
            success. Moreover, the continuity of the project team, and
            close Bank supervision in a broad-based technical assistance
            operation were critical factors in maintaining the momentum
            of the reform program. The intensity of supervision was
            particularly important given the lack of experience of the
            new government, and further helped maintain the momentum of
            the project during governmental changes. Most important, the
            continuity of the project team-during appraisal,
            supervision, and the preparation of follow-up projects -
            allowed for significant levels of consolidation, and
            consistency in the implementation of the financial sector
            reform strategy.
